Description: Pottery ostracon with remains of 11 lines of text on recto containing Ps. 31.10-11.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, probably from the Theban Region
Bibliographic references: Biedenkopf-Ziehner 2000a / Koptische Ostraka I: Ostraka aus dem Britischen Museum in London (p.315-317, pl.47)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82911) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82911)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Robert de Rustafjaell (sold at the Sotheby's auction at 19.12.1906)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II 45 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
